title: How did OTG work since a pen drive needs 5V to operate and a smartphone has a battery of 3.3V? - Quora

response.answer_text: USB OTG is only possible when ID pin of the micro USB connector is shorted to Ground on the host side(android) in the adapter cable.  The average battery voltage used in batteries for smartphones these days ranges from 3.7 to 4.5 volts. Now coming to the question, 5V is produced by the host(smartphone) using boost converters or charge pumps. Here, the input voltage from battery is boosted to 5V. You may refer the below link for a datasheet of one such device which can be used for this kind of application.Page on microchip.com
